document_data.caption: A potion of animal speaking in a decorative bottle.
document_data.name: ''Potion of Animal Speaking''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Potions of animal speaking''''' were magical concoctions that allowed their imbibers to verbally ''[[speak with animals]]'' for a period of time.
document_data.Description: ''Potions of animal speaking'' smelled of hay, musk, and manure. The effects of this potion lasted for one day.
document_data.Creation: A ''potion of animal speaking'' could me created by mixing an essence of [[acorn truffle]]s and certain types of [[alchemical]] [[salt]]s.
document_data.Notable Users:
* [[Arron]], a [[hin]] [[druid]] merchant from the [[Emerald Grove]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
* Auntie [[Ethel]], a [[hag]] disguised as a healer who lived in the Western Heartlands ''circa'' [[1492 DR]], brewed numerous [[potion]]s, including ''potions of animal speaking''.
* [[Derryth Bonecloak]], a [[dwarf|dwarven]] potionmaker and merchant from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
* [[Volothamp Geddarm]], a famous, or infamous writer, carried ''potions of animal speaking'' during his expedition into the [[Chionthar Valley]] and investigation of the [[Cult of the Absolute]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
